properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The first accumulating snowfall of the season. Snow has begun north of Lake Superior and will continue to spread northeast this evening. Snow will taper off by Sunday morning. Current indications suggest snowfall amounts near 10 cm are possible. However, uncertainty remains high with temperatures near zero degrees. Heavy snow could affect road conditions and visibilities. Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-18T12:20:10-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-17T20:21:10-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2279966859.2020
Area: Beardmore - Jellicoe - Macdiarmid, Nakina - Aroland - Pagwa, Geraldton - Longlac - Caramat, Manitouwadge - Hornepayne
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A total of 30 to 50 millimetres of rain is expected over parts of the Lower North Shore by Sunday morning. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall continues tonight. Snow will continue to spread northeast tonight and taper off from southwest to northeast overnight. Current indications suggest snowfall amounts of 4 to 8 cm are possible. However, with warmer temperatures and a mix of rain and snow expected near Lake Superior, snowfall amounts could be much less along the lakeshore. Heavy snow could affect road conditions and visibilities. Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-18T14:19:32-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-18T08:37:32-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2820273951.2020
Area: Nipigon - Rossport, Marathon - Schreiber
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: The first accumulating snowfall of the season will begin tonight. Snow has begun north of Lake Superior and will continue to spread northeast tonight. Snow will taper off Sunday afternoon. Current indications suggest snowfall amounts of 10 to 15 cm are possible. However, the highest amounts are likely in a narrow band that may miss most communities. Attawapiskat and Ogoki Post may receive near 5 cm of snow, while Lansdowne House may receive closer to 2 cm. Heavy snow could affect road conditions and visibilities. Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-18T12:17:04-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-17T20:18:04-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2588378838.2020
Area: Attawapiskat, Fort Hope - Lansdowne House - Ogoki
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Wind Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Strong winds that may cause damage are expected or occurring. An intensifying low pressure system approaching from the Labrador coast will bring very strong east to northeast winds to Pangnirtung today. After the winds settle down, heavy snow will begin tonight. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-18T22:59:52-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-18T08:21:52-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.0382598950.2020
Area: Pangnirtung
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snow Squall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Persistent snow squalls are expected. Under the snow squall bands, visibilities will be significantly reduced due to the heavy snow, and snow will quickly accumulate. Lake Winnipeg North Basin snow squall activity strengthened during the night as cold northwest winds blew over the relatively warm waters of the lake. These squalls are occurring southeastward off the lake, primarily into the Berens River and Bloodvein areas. The snow squalls will persist through today and into Monday before tapering off. Snowfall accumulations will be highly variable across short distances, but accumulations of 15 cm in 12 hours will be possible and some areas may see event total snowfalls as high as 25 to 30 cm by the time it tapers off on Monday. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Rapidly accumulating snow could make travel difficult over some locations. Snow squall warnings are issued when bands of snow form that produce intense accumulating snow or near zero visibilities. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to MBstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #MBStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-19T01:23:51-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-18T09:24:51-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1672240048.2020
Area: Berens River, Bloodvein
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 20 cm is expected. Heavy snow will develop in Qikiqtarjuaq on Sunday as a winter storm system moves towards Baffin Island. Snow will begin on Sunday morning and last until it changes to rain sometime on Sunday evening. Before this change-over, Qikiqtarjuaq will see 10 to 20 cm of snow. Rain will persist through Sunday night and will likely erode much of the snowpack. During the day on Sunday, visibilities may be significantly reduced in heavy snow. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-18T11:32:03-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-17T19:33:03-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2984584445.2020
Area: Qikiqtarjuaq
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 20 cm is expected. An intense low pressure system will push northward over eastern Baffin Island bringing a mixture of heavy snow, mixed rain and snow and strong winds. Snow will begin this morning at Qikiqtarjuaq and continue until it either changes to or becomes mixed with rain some time this evening. Before this changeover, Qikiqtarjuaq will see 10 to 20 cm of snow with perhaps a few more centimetres tonight. The precipitation will end on Monday. At Pangnirtung, after the very strong east to northeast winds settle down later today, snow will begin late this evening or overnight and continue into Monday morning with 10 to 15 cm likely. On Monday the snow there is expected to either change to or become mixed with rain. At Clyde River, snow will begin this evening and continue through Monday with totals of 20 to 30 cm forecast. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-19T00:31:23-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-18T08:32:23-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1396253565.2020
Area: Clyde River, Qikiqtarjuaq, Pangnirtung
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Snowfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snowfall with total amounts of 10 to 20 cm is expected. An intense low pressure system will push northward over eastern Baffin Island bringing a mixture of heavy snow, mixed rain and snow and strong winds. As of 5 a.m. Iqaluit had already received 5 cm of snow, and up to 10 cm more will likely fall before the snow tapers off this evening. Snow will begin this morning at Qikiqtarjuaq and continue until it either changes to or becomes mixed with rain some time this evening. Before this changeover, Qikiqtarjuaq will see 10 to 20 cm of snow with perhaps a few more centimetres tonight. The precipitation will end on Monday. At Pangnirtung, after the very strong east to northeast winds settle down later today, snow will begin late this evening or overnight and continue into Monday morning with 10 to 15 cm likely. On Monday the snow there is expected to either change to or become mixed with rain. At Clyde River, snow will begin this evening and continue through Monday with totals of 20 to 30 cm forecast. ### Visibility may be suddenly reduced at times in heavy snow. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NUstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NUStorm.
Expires: 2020-10-19T01:43:00-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-10-18T09:44:00-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1686222889.2020
Area: Clyde River, Qikiqtarjuaq, Pangnirtung, Iqaluit
